com.caseyscarborough.linkedlist

Class LinkedList

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.caseyscarborough.linkedlist.LinkedList

  • public class LinkedList
extends java.lang.Object
    LinkedList class to implement the Node and LinkedListIterator classes. It is implemented using a header node.
    Since:
    2013-05-04
    Version:
    1.0.1
    Author:
    Casey Scarborough
    See Also:
    LinkedListIterator

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Node header
      The beginning of the linked list.

    • Constructor Summary

      LinkedList()
      Create the list using a constructor.

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Checks to see if the list is empty.

        Makes the list empty.

        public LinkedListIterator zeroth()
        Returns:
        the iterator for the header node of the list.

      • first

        public LinkedListIterator first()
        Returns:
        the iterator for the first node in the list.

      • insert

        public void insert(java.lang.Object x,
          LinkedListIterator p)
        Inserts a new node after p.
        Parameters:
        x - the item to insert.
        p - the position before the one being inserted.

      • find

        public LinkedListIterator find(java.lang.Object x)
        Returns an iterator that corresponds to the first node containing an item to search for.
        Parameters:
        x - the item to search for.
        Returns:
        the iterator.

      • findPrevious

        public LinkedListIterator findPrevious(java.lang.Object x)
        Returns an iterator that corresponds to the node before an item to search for
        Parameters:
        x - the item to search for
        Returns:
        the iterator

      • remove

        public void remove(java.lang.Object x)
        Remove the first occurrence of an item.
        Parameters:
        x - the item to be removed.

      • printList

        public void printList()
        Simple print method to output the list contents. If the list contains another list, output that also.

      • listSize

        public int listSize()
        A simple method to retrieve the size of a specified list.
        Returns:
        size of the list as an integer.
